alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 1:45PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Nenana to Old Minto * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is bankfull from Nenana to Old Minto with minor flooding occurring or expected in some low lying areas. The lower Nenana River at Nenana is also bankfull and may experience minor flooding. As water levels gradually rise into the weekend, areas around Nenana will likely see water going overbank into low lying areas near the river, including the boat landing on the Nenana River. Additionally, rising groundwater may start to impact crawl spaces or pond in town. Minor flooding or bankfull conditions are expected to persist into early next week. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM AKDT, heavy rain that fell over the south slopes of the Alaska Range since last weekend is causing high water on the Tanana River and Nenana River. Additional heavy rain in the Alaska Range and in the Tanana Valley over the next few days will result in more runoff into the Tanana and Nenana Rivers into the weekend. - For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. - For Tanana River at Nenana: At 12:15pm Thu, the stage was 12.55 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 13.2 feet is expected around 10:00pm Sunday. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
